xcsf
Class StateDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  xcsf.StateDescriptor

public class StateDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object

Handles the state description for double valued input states. Basically a collection of input and output arrays of a Function.

Author:
Patrick O. Stalph, Martin V. Butz
See Also:
Function.nextProblemInstance()

Constructor Summary
StateDescriptor(double[] input, double[] output)
          Default constructor, if same input is used for condition and prediction.
StateDescriptor(double[] conditionInput, double[] predictionInput, double[] output)
          Alternative constructor if different input is used for matching and prediction.

Constructor Detail

StateDescriptor

public StateDescriptor(double[] input,
                       double[] output)
Default constructor, if same input is used for condition and prediction.

Parameters:
input - the input for matching and prediction.
output - the output of the function for the given input.

StateDescriptor

public StateDescriptor(double[] conditionInput,
                       double[] predictionInput,
                       double[] output)
Alternative constructor if different input is used for matching and prediction.

TODO Different matching & prediction input. This is not tested, yet.

Parameters:
conditionInput - the input for classifier matching.
predictionInput - the input for prediction.
output - the output of the function for the given input.
Method Detail

getConditionInput

public double[] getConditionInput()
Returns the condition input, i.e. the function input.

Returns:
the conditionInput.

getPredictionInput

public double[] getPredictionInput()
Returns the prediction input, if the function specifies different condition and prediction input. Otherwise the condition input is returned.

Returns:
the predictionInput.

getOutput

public double[] getOutput()
Returns the function output, i.e. f(input).

Returns:
the output.

isSameInput

public boolean isSameInput()
Returns true if the function input is used for matching and prediction. Returns false if there are different inputs for matching and prediction.

Returns:
the sameInput

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
